column2: Export Manager- PaperJoin Knam Marketing Pvt. Ltd., a prominent name in the paper industry, as an Export Manager for Paper. We are seeking an experienced professional to lead our international sales who can contribute to our global growth.Experience: Minimum of 6-8 years.Summary:As an Export Manager at Knam Marketing Pvt. Ltd., you will be at the forefront of our global expansion. Leveraging your extensive experience, you will drive sales initiatives, establish strategic partnerships, and ensure the seamless export of our paper products. Your role will be instrumental in maximizing our market presence and revenue.Responsibilities:- Develop and execute effective international sales strategies to drive paper exports and achieve revenue targets.- Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with international distributors, wholesalers, and clients.- Analyze market trends, competition, and customer preferences to inform strategic decisions.- Lead negotiations, manage contracts, and ensure compliance with trade regulations.- Oversee the preparation of accurate and timely export documentation.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to coordinate procurement, packaging, and logistics.- Optimize shipping and delivery processes while ensuring cost-effectiveness.- Mentor and guide the export sales team, fostering a culture of excellence.Requirements:- Bachelors degree in business, International Trade, or related field.- Minimum of 6-8 years' experience in international sales of paper.- Exceptional negotiation, communication, and relationship-building skills.- In-depth knowledge of global paper markets, trends, and customer preferences.- Proficiency in export documentation, trade regulations, and logistics.- Leadership abilities with a track record of team mentorship and development.Perks and Benefits:Join a company that values innovation, rewards performance, and offers professional growth opportunities. We provide competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and a dynamic work environment.
column13: Export Sales, Exhibition Sales, Packaging, International Business, Paper, Pulp

column2: Machining Specialist (Supplier Quality Engineer) for AP Supply Chain Supplier Quality, Sustainability & Climate Program (based in Gurugram / Pune / Others, India).Are you the enthusiastic, self-driven and result-oriented professional who wants to move our customers performance forward?We are looking for a Machining Specialist to be based in India (Gurugram / Pune / Mumbai / Chennai). This position reports to Supplier Quality Manager. In this position you will have an opportunity to perform activities of Supplier Quality Control specially for precision machined parts and components at suppliers premises for Valmets project and manufacturing phases.In this position, your main responsibilities will be to:Conduct precise dimensional inspections using a variety of measuring tools, such as micrometers, calipers, depth gauges, bore gauges, Sine bars, Pi-Tapes, surface roughness meters and dial indicators. Etc.Verify critical dimensions, tolerances, and geometric features according to engineering drawings, specifications, and quality standards.Ensure customer-specific visual requirements by detecting surface defects, imperfections, or irregularities that may affect product functionality or other visual anomalies.Review engineering documentation, including drawings, specifications, and inspection plans.Monitor machining operations at various stages of production and conduct frequent spot checks to verify dimensional accuracy, feature alignment, and surface finish quality for compliance with established quality standards and process parameters.Identify and address deviations, quality issues, non-conformities, and dimensional discrepancies from specifications promptly to prevent non-conforming product issues.Conduct checks at suppliers for implementing corrective actions and prevent recurrence of quality issues adhering to established protocols.Follow established protocols for non-conformance management, risk assessment, root cause & corrective actions and maintain accurate records of inspection activities, including inspection reports, non-conformance reports (NCRs), and quality documentation for traceability.Provide technical support and expertise to resolve machining quality-related challenges and promote continuous improvement initiatives.Participate in internal audits, quality reviews, and process improvement projects to enhance quality performance.Adhere to applicable quality management systems (e.g., ISO 9001) and quality control procedures.Maintain a safe working environment by following safety protocols, wearing appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), and adhering to safety regulations.Report any safety hazards, incidents, or near misses promptly to supervisors or safety personnel.To succeed this role, you will need:Bachelors Engineering Degree in Mechanical Discipline.Minimum 8 years of relevant experience required in precision machined components inspection for small, medium and large sized machined parts.Working experience on QMS requirements, i.e., ISO 9001, ISO 14001 & ISO 45001 and global quality procedures.Reading of product drawings, instructions, blueprints, samples to ensure accurate product readiness.Working experience with machine tools or mechanical machinery and assemblies.Hands on knowledge on machined components inspection and GD&T.Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. Knowledge in supply chain management and ability to work independently.We offer:We offer you a rewarding position in a global industry leader in pulp, paper and energy industries with the possibilities to grow professionally.If this sounds like something you are looking for and you are ready to go forward on your career, send your application with your CV via the link provided latest by 30 April 2024
